docs.abstract: The Times is reporting from the Olympic Stadium in London, where crowds packed the seats early for a chance to see an opening spectacle overseen by the filmmaker Danny Boyle.
docs.snippet: The Times is reporting from the Olympic Stadium in London, where crowds packed the seats early for a chance to see an opening spectacle overseen by the filmmaker Danny Boyle.

headline.main: Live Blog: Public Hearing on Proposed Soda Ban

docs.abstract: The city’s Board of Health, which will vote on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal to restrict the size of sugary drinks in September, is holding its lone public hearing.
docs.snippet: The city’s Board of Health, which will vote on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal to restrict the size of sugary drinks in September, is holding its lone public hearing.

docs.lead_paragraph: After MaryAnn and Drew Szilagyi, a Houston couple in their early 30s, saw their physician for routine physicals a few years ago, they didn't have to wait for his call about the blood work. Just two days later, Mr. Szilagyi, a banker, logged onto a Web site, perused his lab results and sighed with relief. All normal. But when Mrs. Szilagyi, who sells luxury kitchen equipment, followed suit, no results were displayed. Instead, a message flashed: Contact Doctor's Office.

headline.main: When Health's at Stake, Waiting Is Hardest Part

docs.abstract: Changes in federal regulations may soon allow patients to get the results of important medical tests quickly online, bypassing the nerve-wracking process of waiting for a doctor's telephone call; many experts are concerned that pervasive direct access to test results may have serious drawbacks, leaving patients even more confused and overwhelmed by information they do not know how to interpret. Drawing (M)

headline.main: The Anxiety of Waiting for Test Results
headline.print_headline: When Health’s at Stake, Waiting Is Hardest Part

docs.abstract: More patients can bypass the doctor's call to get test results sooner, but experts are concerned that pervasive direct access to test results may have serious drawbacks.
docs.snippet: More patients can bypass the doctor's call to get test results sooner, but experts are concerned that pervasive direct access to test results may have serious drawbacks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nineteen years ago, Ousley murdered his mother and father at age 14. So why does he think he deserves to get out of prison?

headline.main: Greg Ousley Is Sorry for Killing His Parents. Is That Enough?

docs.abstract: Greg Ousley murdered his mother and father in Indiana in 1993, at age 14; his rehabilitation and the certainty of his eventual release raise questions about what accomplished by sentencing youth to long prison sentences.
docs.snippet: Nineteen years ago, Ousley murdered his mother and father at age 14. So why does he think he deserves to get out of prison?
